TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit SaveFileDialog extends System.Windows.Forms.FileDialog

Docs.summary: Prompts the user to select a location for saving a file. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class can either open and overwrite an existing file or create a new file.
Most of the functionality for this class is found in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FileDialog> class.
## Examples The following code example illustrates creating a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SaveFileDialog>, setting members, calling the dialog box using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CommonDialog.ShowDialog%2A> method, and saving the current file. The example requires a form with a button placed on it.
[!code-cpp[Classic SaveFileDialog Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic SaveFileDialog Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic SaveFileDialog Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic SaveFileDialog Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic SaveFileDialog Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic SaveFileDialog Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This class is safe to instantiate in any security zone; appropriate permission demands are placed on the individual properties and methods.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dialog box prompts the user for permission to create a file if the user specifies a file that does not exist.
Docs.value: if the dialog box prompts the user before creating a file if the user specifies a file name that does not exist; if the dialog box automatically creates the new file without prompting the user for permission. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RichTextBox.SaveFile%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RichTextBox.LoadFile%2A?displayProperty=fullName> methods with streams. It also demonstrates using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FileDialog.FileName%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FileDialog.DefaultExt%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SaveFileDialog.CreatePrompt%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SaveFileDialog.OverwritePrompt%2A> members.
This is a complete example that is ready to run when you copy it to your project.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.RichTextBoxSaveFile#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.RichTextBoxSaveFile/CPP/form1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.RichTextBoxSaveFile#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.RichTextBoxSaveFile/CS/form1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.RichTextBoxSaveFile#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.RichTextBoxSaveFile/VB/form1.vb#1)]

Docs.permission: to set the property. Associated enumeration: .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.IO.Stream OpenFile() cil managed

Docs.summary: Opens the file with read/write permission selected by the user.
Docs.returns: The read/write file selected by the user.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!CAUTION] > For security purposes, this method creates a new file with the selected name and opens it with read/write permissions. This can cause unintentional loss of data if you select an existing file to save to. To save data to an existing file while retaining existing data, use the <xref:System.IO.File> class to open the file using the file name returned in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FileDialog.FileName%2A> property.
## Examples The following code example illustrates creating a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SaveFileDialog>, setting members, calling the dialog box using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CommonDialog.ShowDialog%2A> method, and opening the selected file. The example requires a form with a button placed on it.
[!code-cpp[Classic SaveFileDialog Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic SaveFileDialog Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic SaveFileDialog Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic SaveFileDialog Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic SaveFileDialog Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic SaveFileDialog Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

Docs.permission: to save a file. Associated enumeration: .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dialog box displays a warning if the user specifies a file name that already exists.
Docs.value: if the dialog box prompts the user before overwriting an existing file if the user specifies a file name that already exists; if the dialog box automatically overwrites the existing file without prompting the user for permission. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RichTextBox.SaveFile%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RichTextBox.LoadFile%2A?displayProperty=fullName> methods with streams. It also demonstrates using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FileDialog.FileName%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FileDialog.DefaultExt%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SaveFileDialog.CreatePrompt%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SaveFileDialog.OverwritePrompt%2A> members.
This is a complete example that is ready to run when you copy it to your project.
